column6: NieR:Automata?:  Summary:  Offering a fresh blend of action and RPG gameplay styles
column7: NieR: Automata is the follow-up to the 2010 cult hit NieR
column8: and combines the design talents of Drakengard designer Yoko Taro in collaboration with development team PlatinumGames. The game tells the story of androids 2B
column9: 9S and A2 and their battle to reclaim a machine-driven dystopia overrun by powerful weapons known as machine lifeforms. Invaders from another world attack without warning
column10: unleashing their secret weapon: the machines. In the face of this insurmountable threat
column11: the human race is driven from the earth and takes refuge on the moon. The humans develop an army of android soldiers to fight back against the mechanical horde
column12: but succeed only in slowing its advance. To break the deadlock
column13: a new breed of android infantry is sent into the fray: the YoRHa squad. In the forsaken wasteland below
column14: the war between the machines and the androids rages on. A war that is soon to unveil the long-forgotten truth of this world...  My opinion :  But what a game !!! From start to finish the game will have managed to make me stay without boredom. The synopsis of the story is very interesting and the different characters well exploited with a good background. The phases of actions
column15: rest
column16: sadness ... are very well managed with varying degrees of difficulty. The fights are beautiful and even grandiose I had the impresion to never do the same fight with the music just exceptional accompanying it's moments. I also enjoyed the moments of fighting in Flight Modules which reminded me much of the old game of the time ...The hack system is very good and funny without being complicated at some point . Unfortunately I find that there is too much use of the hack with 9s it is a pity but not disturbing . The game itself is very long and interesting I have 70 hours of game and I have just finished 100%

Об игре и Мелкие детали  Scourge: Outbreak  представляет собой кооперативный (одиночный) шутер от 3-го лица. Основная кампания игры основана на 4-х игроков.    Нам предлагают выбрать следующих персонажей:    Характеристики беру из самой игры         КИРПИЧ  - является лидером отряда. Из сверхспособностей обладает: " Статическая ударная волна"
column11: " Статический щит" . Устойчив к атакам и в бижнем бою.          ГЛЫБА  - или как его называют Утюг. Из сверхспособностей обладает: " Статическая ударная волна"
column12: " Динамический щит" . Устойчив к атакам и мастер по тяжелому вооружению.          АМП  - единственный прекрасный цветочек в кровавой команде. Ее также назыают Электра.  Из сверхспособностей она обладает: " Динамической ударной волной"  и  " Динамическим щитом" . Выносливая и быстрая.          ПРИЗРАК  - пожалуй самый крутой на вид персонаж. Всю игру проходил за него. Из сверх способностей он обладает: " Динамическая ударная волна"  и " Статический щит" . Очень вынослив

Metro Last Light-это прямое продолжение первой части серии игр METRO. За основу взята плохая концовка Metro 2033 где Артем уничтожает черных ракетами. В Metro Last Light было добавлено больше уровней на поверхности и меньше перестрелок с мутантами. Добавлено новое оружие: Пистолет (Подонок)

Hexcells Plus The successor of " Hexcells"  delivers an improved and more challenging version of the original. As the " Plus"  in the name might suggest this game is bigger with 36 levels in total. Like before there are 6 achivements 5 awarded for each world unlocked and the last for completing the game without mistakes.   For more about the gameplay check my review of " Hexcells" . A new memorable concept is added to this game where blues can have a number inside them. by clicking on them they will mark an area and in that area there are the same amount of blues as in the inside of the blue tile with the number excluding itself as a blue. The area can be tuned off and on for better visability and can be marked as finished with right-click(unclickable). Apart from that it is basically the same as its predecessor but more challenging.  I have no idea about the time estimate for completion as I practically did it in one go and took breakes with the game on. 15 hours are recorded so about half or slightly above might be accurate. As I always say when doing these reviews; you should  never  have to  guess  to complete a level
column7: that ruins the game and robs you of the satisfaction of completing it legit.   To Conclude    36 levels    6 achievements    Completion est. 7-10 hours?    Enhanced version of Hexcells    Casual    Good difficulty   -Some levels are huge and a misclick is horrible...     Hexcells Plus  is an improvement to " Hexcells"  and was very enjoyable to play after finishing Hexcells. It also provided something that the predecessor could not; difficulty. While it varied it felt like the levels in general were more difficult and the " gloves or hand holding"  was not as much as in previous installation. In fact level 35 was so difficult that I had to get help
column8: it was in a league of its own. Thankfully one pointer and I could slowly progress and get stuck for short amounts of time untill I finally solved it! As " Hexcells infinite"  has a level generator it might seem better
column9: but those levels are not as interesting or nearly as well made and you almost pay twice for it. In my opinion Hexcells Plus gives the best quality vs value of these 3 games.  Probably I would go for Hexcells Plus if I were to choose one of these three games. I recommend it over Hexcells and in general. 2.99  feels a lot more reasonable in this case but I still would recommend getting it bundled or at a sale. If you want to support the Dev  Matthew Brown  consider buying it at full price it is not a bad deal.   //ECE//

column6: （首先感谢送我这份礼物的好友，一个么么哒>3<） 感觉： 有的谜题有点晦涩啊，真的不考虑给个提示什么的吗，差评。 背景音乐不错，能让人感受到安静。 5关有点太少了..不开心，虽然我卡在了最后那个虫子谜题哪里orz 此游戏不适合有恐虫症的人玩..刚开始还好，到了第二关蝗虫什么的搞得我有点难受，后面几关对我来说几乎都是强忍着过去的...心理阴影面积超大~~ 满分10分，看在你可以回本的份上，给你6分吧~

RPGツク`ルuの殛Lなしアドベンチャ`パズルゲ`だと思いきや、MKXPというLinuxでも幼鳏工RPGツク`ルXP向けエンジンを更にカスタマイズし幼鳏丹护皮い搿RPGツク`ルXPの限界突破したゲ`ム。公式日本Z辍  ゲ`ム内容はネタバレ禁系。 プレイヤ`は太の光を失った崩泊缜挨问澜绀紊瘠趣胜辍⑹澜绀丐郡蓼郡廾预まzんだ主人公ニコを操作し、世界を救う事を目摔诵婴工搿 ストアペ`ジにいてある通り、このゲ`ムではプレイヤ`とニコのコミュニケ`ションがl繁にk生する。所^メタ要素がシナリオの中に丁重にMみzまれており、それが今までのゲ`ムにはoいシナリオと演出をぎ出している。 特に演出。このゲ`ムのような演出をたのは初めてだし、今後も似たものはFれないだろう。  シナリオ自体は崩泊缜挨问澜绀趣いσ馕钉请荬习丹帷￥坤とてもとてもしい世界。 何より主人公のニコがかわいい。ストアペ`ジのイラストて良いなと思ったら即Iいでもいいくらい。すごい良い子です。 既に日本Z版プレイしている人にはvSないけど、2017/3/27に大模アップデ`トがあり、プレイヤ`のxk(OneShot)をBめる必要がoくなった。初期版だけプレイしてそのままにしてる人は勿、新プレイヤ`も{得が行くまでプレイしよう。  々な世界を救い、救いきてきた神（プレイヤ`）におすすめしたい一本。  ちなみにカスタムエンジンは以下で公_されている。  https://github.com/mathewv/mkxp-oneshot

column6: 推荐mod下载： （nass的故事模式mod下载），覆盖了ea本身的故事模式，这样城镇里的每个居民都会有自主意识了，娶妻，生子，结婚，打架，出轨，离婚，自己找工作等等，这样玩起来比较有意思。  （杂物mod）爱装饰房子的人的天堂，一堆零散的东西，使整个屋子更有情调，更加有生活的气息，大到超级大的投影仪电视，小到一瓶瓶的红酒，一块块蛋糕，还有女生最喜欢的包包，鞋子，有各种裙子贴图的衣柜，简直是小公主的生活。  （动作盒子mod）适合做M3剧场版的童鞋们，可以让小人摆出各种各样的动作，配合你想要表达的剧情..  （嘿咻补丁）这个我就不多说了。。好像有5种xxoo的动作。。是会动的you~跟看黄片一样，同时有冒险嘿咻，嘿咻，尝试怀孕等选项，从此以后再也不用盯着被子看他们嘿咻了！！  http://game.3987.com/xiazai/6231.html   （R18各种补丁）洗澡时去除马赛克，打架去烟雾。男生女生身体上必要物件的补丁。。房中术，，可以申请嫖娼做鸡什么的，18岁以下就不要下了。 {LINK REMOVED}  http://pan.baidu.com/s/1b34Sn8   密码 kvu8 （超级电脑）没有超级电脑的M3根咸鱼有什么区别！这个功能太多了，太多太多了，我感觉我才用了40％不到，这个推荐必装  还有一个功能蛮全面的帖子： http://bbs.3dmgame.com/thread-4390774-1-1.html   剩余几个mod，游民，贴吧，搜一搜都能找到，我就不附上链接了，欢迎大家补充   还想吐槽一下，资料片真贵！！前前后后买的资料片花了快1000了，结果夏季特惠，每个资料片才24，我的内心是崩溃的。。。。‘真特么坑啊！

column6: Life is Strange es una experiencia creada por un equipo de DONTNOD el cual tiene un espíritu independiente
column7: y se puede ver muy bien en el titulo.  Personificamos a Max
column8: una estudiante de fotografía artística que vuelve a su ciudad de origen Arcadia Bay para estudiar lo que le gusta
column9: pero un inconveniente le hará cambiar sus planes de la semana para embarcar una aventura en busca de una chica desaparecida.  No dejen que el hecho de ser un juego episodico los ahuyente
column10: como tampoco la primera impresión que puede parecer una típica historia de adolescentes
column11: ya que a medida que avanza la historia el juego se torna cada vez mas oscuro obteniendo un aspecto mas maduro.  Lo primero que se aprecia es el dise?o artístico del juego que puede verse en las mismas texturas que parecen pintadas

column6: I really want to like this game. The world is absolutely amazing. It's so much fun to travel across the vastness of Tamriel
column7: meeting new people
column8: doing quests
column9: familiarizing yourself with local cultures. But the combat is just so boring. Fighting is the least fun part of the game
column10: and that's all the game is asking you to do. Talk to this guy
column11: talk to that guy
column12: kill a bunch of dudes
column13: then kill the boss dude
column14: then get the reward. But killing dudes is neither enjoyable nor exciting. It's a chore. Of course
column15: this has always been a weak point in The Elder Scrolls series
column16: but it's even worse here.  Because this is an MMO
column17: you constantly see other people doing the same quests you're doing
column18: talking to the same people
column19: rescuing the same hostages
column20: putting out the same fires
column21: sometimes even killing the boss before you even get to reach him. And because of this
column22: nothing is permanent. The dudes you kill simply respawn a few seconds later for the next player to come along and kill them again. It breaks the fourth wall and you realize the pointlessness of it all. You're just a hamster in a wheel
column23: going through the motions
column24: and nothing you do actually matters
column25: neither in the game or in the real world. You're just wasting your time.  What Bethesda has always failed to understand is that a first-person game is supposed to be active and dynamic. Look at the mêlée combat system in games like Vermintide 2
column26: Killing Floor 2
column27: Chivalry
column28: even Dishonored. The kills you make are visceral and gratifying. You enjoy killing. It's exciting. Life and death situations are supposed to feel exciting. Not boring.

column6: El mejor sucesor espiritual de juegos como Defender y Chopper Command del Atari 2600. Es un bullet hell con sprites simples y muy colorido. El Gameplay es divertido con múltiples power ups y difícil si quieres completar las misiones sin ningún fallo y en tiempo récord.  Después de probarlo pagaría hasta unos 3 USD por él. Vale mucho la pena y es gratuito.
Плюсы: - визуальный стиль - саундтрек - отсылки Минусы: - непримечательный сюжет - скучный геймплей - корявый платформинг  - крайне скучная боевка

column6: Очередная игра для любителей поработать рукой и набить легких ачивок.  Смысл игры в перетаскивании кусочков картинки для составления целостной картинки. Для каждой девушки можно изменять уровень обнаженки. Игра проходится минут за 10.  Плюсы 1.Если вы любите рисованных девочек-то вам понравится. 2.Можно разглядывать сиськи-письки. 3.Изи 100 ачивок за 10 минут. 4.Уровень сложности для слепых аутистов.  Минусы 1.Карт нет. 2.Уровней очень мало. 3.Рисовка не очень сложная.  Итог Рассматривать игру как что-то серьезное не стоит. Проходняк с голыми тянками. Если надоело убивать монстров или вытаскивать кишки-советую к приобритению. 8 кошкодевочек из 10

column6: Lavado de cara visual y sonoro a un clasico de Sega Master System de principios de los 90.   El juego mantiene la misma estructura y dise?o de nieveles que el original
column7: por tanto
column8: la unica mejora implementada es el exquisito redise?o grafico que nos permitirá alternar en todo momento entre  actual (dibujos y animaciones hecha a mano) o el tradiciona (pixel graphics de 8 bits)  La banda sonora comparte el mismo sistema pudiendo alternar entre  grabacion instrumental o la clasica música de 8 bits  Recomiendo este juego a los que lo disfrutaron en su día y quieran repetir ese momento de nostalgia incluyendo el sistema de logros.  Para el resto de usuarios
column9: brevemente os introduciré que el juego es  scroll lateral  de corte clásico mezclando acción con toques metroid ya que necesitaremos mejoras para avanzar en ciertos puntos.   La duracion puede oscilar las 4-5h y el nivel de rejugabilidad es algo excaso aunque se implementa un nuevo modo en el cual la vida disminuye.  Conclusión== El juego es una llamada a la nostalgia que satisfacerá a los puristas que solo quieran tener el juego y disfruten de la nueva animacion pero dejará con ganas de algo más de sustancia a los jugadores experimentales en el genero que busquen acción.  Hay que recordar que se trata de una Adaptación gráfico-sonora de un clasico de los 90 y si solo evaluamos eso tenemos un juego notable. Si se tratara de un Remake al uso lo evaluaría de un modo más severo.   Esperad a una buena rebaja y no dudeis comprarlo pues en cualquier caso es divertido.  Nota final 8/10

column6: civ5から始めたものです。よって、civ5との比^になってしまうかもしれません。  まず荬摔胜盲康悚ら  今作はペナルティが存在しないことでI土と都市占だけが国になるための道となってしまっている点です。特にシングルのAI高y易度だと立地が良くない限りはAiの都市を食うことでしか国力のがyしくなっています。つまり、序Pの婴では都市スパムor初期ラッシュが必になってきてしまうということ。自分としてはciv5で4都市ほどの小都市U婴好きでしたのでその榉àほぼ通じなくなったことは悲しいです。 また、テクノロジ`や社会制度のブ`ストC能ははじめてやったころは画期的だと思いましたが、必要科学（文化）力の４０％ほどブ`ストできてしまうことからどこかのテクノロジ`特化で目指すよりブ`スト狙いで婴い郡郅ΔY果的にM行は早いわけです。civ5でいうと、弩兵のテクノロジ`をいちもくさんに取りに行き、他国が弩兵テクノロジ`がないころに弩兵ラッシュを仕欷堡毪胜勺苑证撕悉盲槁预蚪Mめたのですが、civ6ではテクノロジ`はある程度ブ`ストに\っかったほうがはやい（むしろブ`ストのないテクノロジ`をやるのがpになる）ので、Y果的に槁预畏を狭める原因になっていたりしてます。（あくまで人の解）  良いと思った点  F在出ている大型DLCは１つですが、DLCなしのo印でもciv5に比べるとシステムの基Aはあるのでちゃんと[べるという点です。ですので、civ6やったことないが荬摔胜毪趣いΨ饯悉蓼亥钎獍妞颔抓欹い筏皮瑜丹菠坤盲郡o印g体で入してもまずまずは[べると思います。段的にはFr点のゴ`ルドエディションのほうがお得ではあります。 今回から入された、Tハブシステムは荬巳毪盲皮ります。自分の都市が何特化の都市なのか明_にわかる点や、建造物がえていくさまが都市が反映していくのが味わえてとても良いです。 期待をzめて荬摔胜氲悚蚨啶きましたが既にciv5の起rgを超えております（笑）  大型DLC第1RaFの追加要素について  まず、「忠\心」 各都市に忠\心という概念が追加されました。忠\心はその都市の忠\度を表していて周りの都市同士影しあってます。自国とはxれたo理な鏊に都市建Oしようとするとすぐに反乱を起こしてしまいます。都市スパムゲ`としてみると高y易度AIだと都市出しスピ`ドが速いのでこちらも早く都市出しをする必要があり、序Pのム`ブがより一俞岚毪蓼琼いてしまう原因となっているように感じます。ただAIも引な都市出しは多少pったと思います。  次に、「t督」 t督は各都市に配置でき、都市の特色をより引き出してくれたり、立てたばかりの都市の支えにはうってつけです。T家をどこに派遣するか考えるrgもSしめると思います。忠\心にも影を与えるので配置はしっかり考えさせられます。  最後に、「r代スコア」 暗\r代から～黄金r代まで存在し、忠\心に大きく影を与えます。暗\r代では反乱がおきやすくなるのでo理なができなくなる分、自国の内政に精を出せます。黄金r代ではr代突入で取れるボ`ナスをうまく生かして新都市や、宣椴几妞蛐肖à毪韦钎抓欹い衰幞辚膝辘出たと思います。r代スコアを稼ぐためのム`ブをするか否かも自分次第ですので幅が出たと思います。

column6: El truco en mi situación era que no había truco, no importa lo que digan las películas. Sin reglas, sin mantra secreto, sin mapa de carreteras. No se trataba de lo listo o de lo bueno que fueses: se trataba del caos y de la suerte, y cualquiera que pensase de modo diferente era un tonto. Todo lo que podías hacer era resistir furiosamente, tanto y tan duro como pudieses.     Max Payne fue uno de los primeros juego que para mi marcó una época
column7: en plena etapa de escuela secundaria durante el 2001/02 cuando tuve la primera oportunidad de jugar este juego
column8: no podía creer que hubiera un juego tan literalmente sombrío como oscuro no solo en su ambiente
column9: sino en su estética y en su argumento. A tal punto que me parecía un juego sumamente opresivo con solo verlo correr. Pero enorme fue mi sorpresa cuando tuve la posibilidad de jugar la demo. El trailer de la E3 de aquellas fechas no lograba hacerle honor a este juego. Todo lo que rodea a Max
column10: desde los personajes
column11: el escenario como sus sombríos monólogos y su sarcasmo
column12: tienen una razón perfectamente explicada y narrada por Sam Lake quien también ofrece su apariencia para dar vida a este detective de rostro constipado para cuando se mete en medio de un tiroteo.  Max Payne narra la historia de venganza de un oficial de policia al cual le asesinan a su mujer y a su hija cuando regresaba de trabajar. Para encontrar a los culpables originarios de la masacre de su hogar
column13: Max le solicita a su amigo Alex Balder

column15: a su domicilio con el fin de iniciar la matanza. column6: Muchos fuimos atraídos por el arte de éste juego desde su primera presentación en el E3 del 2015. La espera fue larga y al final fuimos bien recompensados con un gameplay sólido y difícil que hace recordar a los Megaman de NES que eran difíciles en verdad.  Dejando de lado el arte
column7: los controles son excelentes y se requiere una coordinación y precisión milimétrica en algunos casos. En ocasiones los jefes son más simples que todo el nivel
column8: pero a veces es al revés.  A?ade un plus para los " Completionist"  el poder pasar cada nivel cumpliendo ciertos retos. Puedes vencer a los jefes en dificultad baja para saber más o menos cuál es su comportamiento
column9: pero para que cuente como vencido tendrás que enfrentarlo en dificultad regular
column10: donde incrementan las fases y los ataques hacia ti.  Es más fácil que muchos juegos del tipo " Bullet Hell"
column11: pero más difícil que muchos juegos de plataforma actuales.  Cuphead vino a llenar los zapatos que no pudo llenar Mighty No. 9 con una integración de arte
column12: música y gameplay que difícilmente podrá ser igualada en el futuro próximo. Pruébalo y te enamorarás...

column6: I bought this game for less than 2. Turned out it was the smartest investment I've ever made. A brilliant and unique game with strong emphasis on the story rather than constant action and shooting. This game requires to be played patiently and thoroughly since there are a lot of hidden passages and areas. Also
column7: each mission can be approached differently so the game deifinitely has a replay value. Graphics are a bit outdated
column8: but it's not really a problem when you're playing an immersive and clever game like this one. Long story short
column9: this game is a masterpiece. My highest recommendations.

column6: I strongly recommend this game. Even with the people complaining about lag in the forums
column7: I played it with my friend and had no problems at all. And being a huge fencing fan
column8: I think this game is perfect in the format it was made. You really need to approach the fight strategically or you'll get your derrière sistematically handed to you. The game is one hit kill when armed with sword and when disarmed if your opponent strikes you on the ground he'll snap your neck and kill you
column9: but this is just a mean to an end
column10: since your main goal ain't to kill your opponent but to get to the last screen you need to push to be devoured by the mythical serpent Nidhogg
column11: hence the name of the game
column12: and to do that you need to kill you enemy and  move forward through each screen
column13: being lead to a fence-fueled tug of war. And the graphics
column14: soundtrack and sound effects match the game perfectly and until now I didn't experienced any major flaws on the gameplay of the game which is fluid and easy to get the hang. The single-player can be fun enough
column15: but the game really shines in the multiplayer
column16: the local versus can make for a really neat party game. So scrap some cash and buy this gem.

column6: Its amazing how much content and hours of fun you can get for 10.

2.3h一周目通关，游戏还有NG+和限制开场金钱数的挑战模式。   简评  Let them come就如他的介绍所说，是一款快节奏的横版射击游戏。像素的游戏画面配合上武器特效足够刺激，但是在爽玩一个周目之后就会发现，游戏一些小的亮点（射击的策略性）并不能完全盖掉那些显得有点蛋疼的BOSS设计。虽然游戏的音乐质量不错，但让玩家自己折腾到底要放哪首BGM在这种快节奏游戏里显得有点打乱节奏。如果你是喜欢这类横板射击游戏的玩家，或许Let Them Come会是一款能让你享受一个下午的游戏。   射击  作为一款横板射击游戏，Let them come的射击本身的层次是达标的（近身战，射击，手雷），但他并不像很多同类游戏一样强调一场战斗你可以切换N种武器的所谓“策略深度”。  玩家每条命只能使用一种手雷，一个副武器，和两种可以切换的机枪子弹。玩家需要用飞刀，电锯，冰冻雷这些武器库里的东西组合出一套不错的配装，如果你觉得某一套不合适也不用担心，玩家可以把买到的装备全额退款，这也说明了作者鼓励玩家尝试不同的配装。  用信号弹+爆炸子弹将几十个虫子一起歼灭，或者用莫洛托夫+电锯来对付来袭的盾兵，这两个都很好，但玩家没法全要，有限的道具代表每种配装不可能完美。但还好，玩家还有四个被动技能可以改变角色的属性，让我们的雇佣兵变得更强。   策略  受限于整个游戏的体量和开发成员（只有一个主作者），Let them come的敌人设计做的相当简约，这也导致游戏的BOSS阶段应对策略相当单一，敌人一直在考验玩家的DPS和考验玩家的特定操作两者之间摇摆，也导致在某几个BOSS关，你如果没有达到一定的DPS
column7: 就算你什么操作都做了也无济于事，而另外一个关卡里，没带手雷就直接自寻死路了。  相对来说普通关卡的游戏流程更舒服一点，玩家经常能触发连击从而获得随机的临时奖励来增强自己的战斗力，一些攻击特定敌人的策略也能较好的执行，而整个游戏无限续关（死了直接在当前关继续）的机制也决定了玩家很少会关心特定关卡的敌人顺序，玩家可以沉浸在这种氛围中而不用担心被连续打断的情况。（如果一直过不了那可能真的就是要换装备了）   虽然异形杀戮之旅本身相当愉快，但回过头来看那些碎肉的时候总有种自己怎么就把他们打炸了的惊讶。这种横版射击有的时候就是需要自己沉浸其中才能体会到那种快感，虽说游戏本身中规中矩，但重要的是他并不需要你消耗什么脑细胞。

column6: Toybox Turbos This game feels really unique. In fact I have not had such a positive surprise like this one for quite some time!  It is a racing game with six different game modes (only one in mp) which incorporates a very nice concept; Cars with guns and powerups. There are older games and mario kart alike games that remind of this game. They share a very important success factor; they are great party games which gives replayability.  The setting is beautiful with great immersion to the condcept of the toy vehicles you race with. The camera of this  top-down  viewed game is really good single-player but can be frustrating with other players as it becomes difficult to see if you are far ahead which means that you have to know the map to effectively outrun other players without the risk of dying.  There are a couple of power ups available in this game: mines
column7: hammer
column8: mini-gun
column9: magnet
column10: rocket-booster
column11: and EMP (I think it represents). The hammer is ridiculously un-balanced as one hit instant-kills a pleyer and you have 4... This is particulary obvious on a certain single-player track... The mini-gun is very powerful but not as insane as the hammer. The game features 16 achievements which are very well made and is the reason I eventually bought it. It is a good amount not too few or too many. Another thing that has to be mentioned are that there are some small bugs (fell through a stage twice and died by jumping too high on a ramp) and that some people have resolution or startup issues. Me and my brother only had a game crash each.  There is one game in particular that I have played a lot which is similar and the first game I think of:  https://store.steampowered.com/app/281280/Mashed/   ||||| " Mashed"   has better balanced weapons and is more focused on weapons. The stages and graphics are not as good and the vehicle variety is very small. I think that the pricetag 4
column12: 99 that Mashed has should be the same for Toybox Turbos as 14
column13: 99 is waay to much to ask for. If you like Mashed check this game out the same goes the other way around. |||||   Single Player Toybox Turbos has a " single-player campaign"  where you can clear bosses to unlock them as playable cars*(not all can be called cars) for multiplayer. I was very satisfied playing the campaign as it was well balanced between difficulty and challenge past the first cup which was too easy.  Basically there are a couple of cups which make up the campaign. You can progress to the next one after earning a certain amount of stars (unsure if boss has to be beaten to progress). A maximum of three can be awarded per stage depending on your performance.  Each cup has a couple of stages with different game modes and a boss. All cups have a certain type of vehicles tied to the area (service cars
column14: emergency
column15: racers etc.) which means that you have to buy at least one new car at each cup to be able to pay. Money is awarded based on performance for each stage
column16: but there are also (usually) coins on the stages that can be collected to make a little extra. Coins are only used for buying cars.  It took me about 3 hours to beat the single-player campaign and get every achievement. While some stages can be hard and  VERY  unfair
column17: it is not a long game though with its 35 vehicles and 18 courses it has some good content.   Multiplayer Multiplayer can be played both locally and online with up to 4 players. A complaint made by others which is very true is the lack of players online. If you intend to get this game make sure to have friends to play it with as that is a big part of this game
column18: online or local does not matter except for  achievement . You can set bots and change some settings
column19: most notable is the " artillery"  option (think it was called artillery). It gives knocked out human players the ability to lock on and hit players with a rocket. This can be done several time as it has a cool down intead of a limit of one.  I have almost played multiplayer as much as single-player and believe that it is the most fun part about the game. It is the only replay value to me and can be very fun especially with " buggy"  things happening or stage hazards. I like to use heavy vehicles and bully light vehicles. It is one of the best things about this game that you can drift and shove other players out the stages etc.    To Conclude    Top-down racing game with powerups    Single-Player Campaign    Beautiful graphic with immersive " toy courses"     35 vehicles    18 courses    16 achievements    Unlockable boss vehicles for Multiplayer    Coin system to unlock cars for the campaign    Star-rated performance for each of the stages    7 Cups with specific vehicle types available to each one    6 game modes (campaign only]    Shortcuts    4 player online/local which can be mixed together    -bugs (can be fun too :D)    - Some experience startup or resolution problems    - Short: only 3 hours~ to finish campaign and all achievements    - 0 players online    - Overpriced   Toybox Turbos  is a very fun game with lots of replayability if you have some friends that play the game online or come over to your couch. It is a party game with and enjoyable campaign
column20: but sadly waay to pricey vs the lenght. I recommend this game if you can get it during a  sale  and have  someone to play it with regulary . When I got this game me and my brother played it for almost 6 hours in one session with half of it together in the middle of the night. I hope the price gets down to 4
column21: 99 retail as the asking price is again waay to much! I am very happy with this game but I payed a very small amount for it.   //ECE//

column6: 我是一个喜欢雪的人，也许因为生在南方，对于下着鹅毛大雪的冬天有种过分浪漫的幻想。 然而在这个游戏里，独自在冰天雪地的深山老林里醒来，衣着单薄，笨手笨脚，冷得咬牙切齿，却连篝火都点不起来，浪费完所有火柴。我终于对雪有了一丝敬畏。 哪怕在最简单的朝圣者模式活了将近50天，也还是不能掉以轻心，出远门的时候不注意用光了火柴、食物中毒却没带胃药或药草，还是可能分分钟死掉。熟练运用S/L大法的我，不知被死亡删档多少次了。 虽然我方向感很好，还是觉得TLD没有地图这个设定太真实，对路痴非常不友好，每当遭遇险境却又迷了路，真是想死的心都有。  曾经数次饥肠辘辘只剩0.02%饱腹，曾经食物中毒只剩15%健康，冒着暴风雪翻山找食物找药材，每次都以为自己快要死了，听到角色的喘息声感到莫名恐惧，却在狂灌花茶和偶遇药草之后，绝处逢生。一瞬间觉得，啊，活着真好。 作为生活在人群中的普通人，我大概不会置身这样绝境，但我希望那种“无论如何也要活下去”的信念，能一直一直支持着我面对生活。  i have to say i really immersed in the animal panic against death. but that means this game is good at creating such atmosphere. 8/10 and i hope players would be allowed to jump in the game

column6: 【良い点】 ?立体的に冥ぅ蕙氓 ?美しい景Q ?N富な武器とアタッチメント ?バリエ`ションNかなキャラメイク ?自由度の高いゲ`ムプレイ ?キャラクタ`同士の欷焙悉い浈楗弗 ?Ansel   【い点】 ?淡々とMんでいきがちなミッション（" g{" と言うよりかは演出が足りない） ?理不尽な偿攻荸`ン ?不H切なマッチング仕 ?\り物の/操作   大模麻aカルテル " サンタ?ブランカ"  を根~するため诖螭圣堀辚鹰へと潜入するオ`プンワ`ルドTPS     － R倒的スケ`ルで描き出されるボリビア このゲ`ムを始めてまず思うこと、それは とにかくマップが冥 ということである。しかもただ冥い坤堡扦胜、それぞれの地域に特色があり、新しい地域に足を\ぶごとに思わずその景色にとれてしまう。この景色の_さはそのままプレイをAけるモチベ`ションにもつながるだろう。「あそこに訾えるから行ってみよう」とか「この山からの景色がキレイそうだから登ってみよう」といった具合に、ミッションの合g、ちょっとした移rgに息iきで探索できるのもこのゲ`ムの魅力の一つである。Nvidia Anselにも辘筏皮い毪韦钎攻ショも非常に盲搿  http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=893281847    － 好きなときに好きな服装?装浃 キャラクタ`や|器のカスタマイズのN富さは、本作の大きな魅力としてい菠椁欷搿％ャラクタ`であれば^?から足までかく服装や装浃蛟O定でき、|器であればサイトやアンダ`レ`ル、バレルやマズル等を好きなようにカスタマイズすることができる。また、どちらもゲ`ム中いつでも涓することが可能なのも嬉しい点である。そのためミッションによって狙膜丐筏郡辍⒔距x殛Lに特化したりといったSしみ方もできる。  多少便利すぎる荬猡工毪ゲ`ムとして面白いので良しとしよう。    http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=882956860    － ミッションの攻略法はo限大 ミッション攻略における自由度の高さも本作のウリで、こっそり忍びzんでステルスするも良し、正面突破でランボ`プレイするも良し、他にもh距xからの狙膜淇栅らの奇u、レベルが上ってくれば爆aドロ`ンで爆なんてこともできてしまう。マップに点在する点は数が多いにもvわらずそれぞれしっかりとした作りになっているものが多く、特に大型の点であると索长ら作椁斡画、そしてgHにg行するまでの流れがが非常にSしく感じられた。どの番で倒していくか、狙膜颏工毪胜椁嗓长岁取るか、どこから侵入したらうまくいきそうかなど、そういった槁预蚩激à毪长趣rgを欷堡毪韦猡长违博`ムの醍醐味である。  http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=886163057    － 所々にFれる理不尽さ?不旱 概ねゲ`ムプレイはSしいし、（自分のh境では）特に幼鳏不安定なこともないのだが、やはり不氦实悚猡いつかある。ここではマッチングについての不氦蛱毓Pする。   マッチングについて   まず、なぜホストになることをxkできないのか。メインスト`リ`のM行度はホストに依存するので、いざマッチングしてみたら自分がまだクリアしていないミッションがクリアgになってしまうといった}がk生する。故にスト`リ`をちゃんとMめたいならフレンドとプレイするか、ソロで一通りクリアしておくしかない。次に、なぜy易度が同期されないのか。例えば4人全Tがバラバラのy易度O定にしてマッチングした龊稀ホストのO定にy一されるとかではなく、そのまま人のO定が反映される。そのため3人が最高y易度でヒイヒイ言っている中、1人だけ最低y易度にO定しているプレイヤ`がo双するという状rが起こり得る。なぜこの仕にしたのかは甚だ疑である。   【tu】 マップはかなりの冥丹恰ロケ`ションはN富、景色は素晴らしく、自由度は高いと、オ`プンワ`ルドとしてはかなりの高水胜扦工伽皮我素がまとまっている。服装や装浃违スタマイズが充gしている点も高くuでき、あとはマルチプレイ周りの改善や追加のコンテンツ次第といったところだろうか。マップ探索が好き、ステルスが好き、|をいじるのが好き、こういったことに当てはまる人は是非このゲ`ムをプレイしてもらいたい。  【余】   萘Δ我护摹その名前はユニダッド（UNIDAD）。ユニタッドでもユニダットでもユニマットでもない。ゲ`ムの最初から最後までいるくせに一向に名前をえてもらえない ウザい 悲しい存在だ。

column7: the ninja cyborg from the Metal Gear series
column8: and you work as a private sucurity firm for governments around the word. In the very first chapter of the game you meet up with another private security firm called “desperado” who uses its arsenal to provoque conflicts and wars and generate more demand for private security like the one they offer. This leads to unfolding an evil plot around the government of the United States.   Gameplay  This is probably the best Hack and Slash game I’ve ever played
column9: both because of its story and its smooth gameplay. You really feel like you are some kind of future ninja badazz cyborborg slashing everything in your way with this game. You have an energy bar called “blade mode” that allows you to slice apart almost everything in the game
column10: be it enemies or simply the environment. This is one of the few games that actually give you the sensation of being using a sword as a cutting weapon

column16: before fighting

column10: uma melhora gráfica muito perceptivel comparada ao primeiro jogo - Cenários muito bem trabalhados com várias formas de chegar ao seu objetivo - Dismembramento - Gameplay frenética - Muitas side quests - Novo sistema que agora lhe permite ca?ar e matar Ubercommanders - Dire??o de arte incrivel - Dublagem muito boa! as vozes se encaixam perfeitamente na maioria dos personagens - Trilha sonora exepcional! se encaixa em cada momento no jogo! tanto em uma boss fight quanto tentando se infiltrar em uma base nazista em modo stealth - Cutscenes divertidas - Tio adolfo  Contras: - Alguns bugs no cenario e no céu  - As vezes texturas n?o renderizam  - Cutscenes extremamente longas - Poucas horas de gameplay - Arsenal pequeno - Pouca diversidade de inimigos  - Atraso na dublagem - Miss?es secundárias repetitivas e depois de um tempo chegam a ser entediantes - Drop de frames    Isso é minha opini?o sobre o jogo! das coisas que eu gostei e n?o gostei!  Wolfenstein n?o é um jogo para todos! se você se ofender fácil recomendo n?o jogar esse jogo pois contém: Piadas racistas

Начнём с того что те кто пишут что то плохое бред. Понятное дело на вкус и цвет но всё же. Игра - отличная! Яуверен что половина не пняла даже 10 долю сути этой игры. Особенно концовка боже... Это нереально.  Жаль что она короткая.  Тут соглашусь. Коротка. column6: Una gran experiencia multiplayer local. Controles extremadamente simples donde el trabajo en equipo es la única opción para pasar todos los escenarios con la máxima puntuación. Necesitarás más de una ocasión para entender cómo trabajar más eficientemente en cada escenario. RIP AND TEAR!    Doom (2016) is an FPS game that tries to bring something old school to the current FPS games. By old school I mean: less story
column7: more action and less repetitive bullcrap that the genre is full of nowadays.    The Shooting  The shooting is intense and frantic: you are usually locked inside a large arena-like place and the monsters start to spawn from demonic portals non-stop until you destroy em all! You have a variety of weapons at your disposal
column8: such as shotguns
column9: chainguns and laser beam weapons. They are usually pretty powerful and ripe the demons apart
column10: exposing their vicera in a pretty gory and inbstense way. It’s really satifying to explode a demon into pieces or to rip off a Cacodemon’s eye just for fun. Violence and gore are garanteed in this game   The Pacing  The pacing in this game is divide in two moments: One which you are exploring the environment looking for weapons and stuff and Two when the demons appear and you start to run and gun like crazy
column11: making you heart pump non-stop. This game will wake you from whatever state of numbness you are and put you into frenzy!   The Story  The story is pretty simple: Crazy scientists found a way to extract some kind of energy from Hell through a portal. But something wents wrong and the demons break loose. Now it up to you
column12: as the Doomguy
column13: to close the portal and the kick the demons’s azzes.    The Bad Side  This game has only a few flaws. One being that the action might be kinda repetitive and predictable sometimes
column14: as you are usually locked inside and arena to kill the deamons. This scenario repeats itself over and over
column15: só it might get tiresome after a while. Also

column17: but I can’t tell exactly if it’s a problem with the game or with my crappy potato PC…   Overal

column6: Aventura 2D de corte clásico
column7: que nos recuerda la época dorada de los 16 bits. Con un Pixel Art exquisito y una jugabilidad que si bien no aporta nada nuevo al género
column8: se muestra divertida durante toda la historia.   Los personajes son carismáticos y el protagonista (un chico-buho) a pesar de no decir ni una palabra muestra todas sus emociones y se hace de querer por el jugador.  + Los puzzles y exploración son sencillos
column9: y lo único a destacar es que
column10: en ocasiones
column11: te cansarás de matar a los enemigos simples del escenario.  + Tiene peque?os toques de plataformeo
column12: peque?as pinzeladas de infiltración y una mecánica de combate divertida   + La historia es coherente con el universo y estética que muestra el juego y a pesar de no tener giros inesperados es muy disfrutable  +Tanto los personajes principales como algunos secundarios tienen toques de humor que no te harán desternillarte pero si que te sacarán la típica sonrisa de sabado tarde.  Conclusión. Un juego de corte clásico
column13: que explota muy bien sus recursos y nos da un mundo colorido y hermoso con personajes carismáticos y una historia que envuelve y cierra el conjunto de manera notable.   Muy recomendado 8/10

Veredicto final:  Lo bueno:  - Toma de decisiones con consecuencias tangibles - Cutscenes muy bien logradas - Historia muy poco predecible - Personajes sumamente memorables - Minijuegos a lo largo de la aventura - Mundo en general - Misiones secundarias de calidad - Guion y actuaciones de voz - Gráficos a la altura - Extras gratuitos en la versión de GoG - Precio  Lo malo:  - Bugs - Algunas animaciones de personajes en conversaciones - Imposibilidad de volver a las zonas anteriores  9.5/10  Witcher 2 es el perfecto ejemplo de como CD-Projekt da cátedra de juegos de rol

column31: карается проиграшем. В игре действует одно внегласное правило. Всегда нажимать числа в том порядке
column32: в котором они появились на экране. Со временем скорость появления новых цифр возрастает. Появляются целые цепочки чисел. Для удобства нужная цифра всегда подсвечивается
column33: а линия к следующему числу мигает и указывает направление к нему.  Следующий режим схож с режимом чисел. Нам необходимо вовремя реагировать на появляющиеся символы и нажимать кнопки в нужный момент. На этот раз символами являются буквы английского алфавита. При спавне большого количества букв

Echo Tokyo: Intro  Summary: Echo Tokyo: Intro is a mini-game that acts as an introduction to the Echo Tokyo world and its people.  Included within are short interactive graphic novels telling origin stories of some of the main characters of the city.  Currently the game includes the following stories:  Shizume's Origin Story - Which includes full voice acting and narration. Coming within the next few weeks is a second story that will introduce Keiji to you all
column7: a powerful mercenary within the game. Echo Tokyo is the last bastion of humanity.  A nuclear fog has made street level uninhabitable.  Now hundreds of years later Echo Tokyo lives on
column8: by building bridges and platforms between the skyscrapers to create a new city in the sky.  This cyber punk city somehow manages to function without government or law
column9: where the companies rule and order is what people make it for themselves.The first short graphic novel story introduces Shizume Misaki
column10: in this fully voiced graphic novel telling her tale as she begins working as a Fixer within Echo Tokyo.  It is said that a fixer will take any job as long as the price is right. Though many act mainly as private investigators
column11: many others will do any job to pay the rent.  What will become of Shizume on one of her first big jobs as she visits into the most dangerous area of the city... The Slums.  This story includes over 6000 words of spoken lines.  As well as 80 unlockable illustrations to the complete the story. The second short graphic novel story introduces Keiji Light and is due to be released within the next four weeks before the end of February.  This fully voiced graphic novel telling his tale
column12: from when he was abducted and experimented on as a child and what that means for him now.  This story will include over 6000 words of spoken lines.  As well as around 80 additional illustration to unlock.  My opinion : Echo Tokyo: Intro and a super cool game the graphics are really nice game and well done as the music used at the right time the scene is of good quality and more in the game and so I think Kickstarter campaign to make a small game so .the has great potential as future DLC has come that makes me really want then the game really has a style of its own and I really love the choice of action we had to do during the story and a good game of this quality cost 3 euro and recent and bloody + DLC to 99 cents  Thème :  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kZitX3T_bg0   Conclusion :  this game is worth the cost for the story set to music at the right time and really affordable and the DLC comes out later this month in February (and the next studio project which seems equally interested)

column6: Crossout  И сегодня я вам коротко расскажу как тащить в этой игре: 1.Строем трактор.2.Снабжаем трактор.3.Выселяем его в мастерскую под названием 228_ТЕРМИНАТОР_КАКАКХИН_228.4.Красим трактор в розовый или в коричневый для 100% нагиба.5.Начинаем катку.6.Сидим на спавне и ждём пока наших тиммейтов убьют.7.Когда у вас уже 500% ХП и у вас безысходность просто ливаем и пишем в чат " GG WP" .   А теперь к самой игре. ======================= ГЕЙмплей: 10/10. Управляемость: 9/10. Раки: 100/10. Твоё творчество: 10/10. Графика: 9/10. Бабка зина: 666/10 ======================== Это был короткий обзор об игре Crossout.

column6: The only regret I have after finishing  Layers of Fear  is that I won't be able to experience the game like the first time I played it
column7: ever again. It was a memorable journey
column8: which
column9: even though admittedly short
column10: was worth every cent.  You play as a painter who's gone insane over his obsession with perfection in his works of art. Through the story you'll recall memories that surrounded him and his family and how his profession completely changed his world
column11: his attitude etc. While the narration is not particularly mind-blowing
column12: it's the events which happen throughout player progression that mainly consolidate the story. The game is split in a prologue and six chapters
column13: all of them happening around the spectrum of your  magnum opus
column14: a new masterpiece you're working on. As you are progressing through the narrative you will understand how the plot takes a darker turn with each new chapter.  In regards to the genre
column15: I can firmly say that  Layers of Fear  does a fantastic job at bringing suspense and fright to the player. There is no combat
column16: and dying will not have you reload an older checkpoint (though it will lead to a different ending). Instead
column17: most of the horror is brought to you by the uncertain and the jump scares. Indeed
column18: the game is filled with them
column19: but in my opinion they make the game a lot better. Sure
column20: many people may disagree with me here. I am not a fan of cheap
column21: cliché-ish jump scares either
column22: and that's exactly why I loved them in  Layers of Fear : they're different. It's difficult to explain exactly how they work without spoiling the game. In short
column23: they're much more than random meshes thrown at you. It feels like they're building the story in their own way.  The gameplay is the standard one usually encountered in games of this sort: you walk/run across the rooms
column24: interacting with the environment in order to progress or to uncover memories of the protagonist's past. You can not defend yourself from the enemy
column25: but there's only a few encounters with them
column26: all of which can be avoided as well.  The graphics are absolutely top-notch and a notable feat both from the development team and the Unity engine. Many times I stopped from advancing in the game only to stare at the paintings on the walls
column27: or at the attention to detail in various scenarios. It is definitely a visual gem
column28: which immensely adds to the immersion factor and overall to an even greater atmosphere.  The sound design is purely a masterpiece. Being an audiophile
column29: I paid attention all the time to the background noises and music.   The sound effects are very well polished and in harmony with the pace of the game. The wind and the trees outside
column30: the lights cutting out
column31: whispers of the past etc. all make up for the horror ambiance.   The voice acting
column32: while not distinctly catchy
column33: is not half bad. Most of it will be heard when the player finds a memento
column34: so it's not intrusive in any way.   The soundtrack is astounding and one of the main reasons I replayed the game multiple times. Immersive melodies accompanying the player
column35: with changing themes depending on the scenario.   It is worth saying that  Layers of Fear  is an incredibly atmospheric game
column36: mainly because of the aforementioned graphics and sound quality
column37: but also thanks to the incredible level design set by the developers. It's a game playing with your brain
column38: the rooms changing their appearance as you trigger certain events
column39: returning to some places only to find them completely different etc.
column40: delivering the player a taste of the painter's madness.    Summary:     Pros:   + Unique
column41: memorable
column42: true  horror experience
column43: amplified by a dark story line
column44: breathtaking visuals and exceptional sound effects; + An atmosphere unseen before
column45: with an interesting level design concept (interiors changing as the player looks back etc.)
column46: living up to its title of " psychological horror" ; + Marvelous soundtrack and totally immersive audio effects; + Gorgeous graphics; + The story is mostly built by the world elements the players can interact with
column47: never enforcing cutscenes; + In my 20 hours of playtime I don't recall encountering a single glitch

column6: One of my favourite games
column7: I was given this by a friend and I then suggested this to another friend and we all really enjoy it and we all feel similarly about it. As usual I will break this into Pros and Cons  Pros: ~Very well written. ~Wide variety of characters
column8: some that you actually will care a great deal about. ~Interesting art style. I haven't seen many games that almost look like a painting
column9: it's very charming. ~Gorgeous soundtrack.  Cons: ~Some things will not age well. There's a lot of 2014/2015 pop culture references that may not be very relevant in the future. ~A couple of clichéd characters
column10: not enough to hinder your enjoyment though.  This game does a lot of things right and is one of very few games that have left a lasting impression on me
column11: and that's what is a good game to me. Something that you may not have played in a while but you still think about. If you want to feel something on the inside that you haven't felt for years then this is the game for you.

column6: Hitman is a game that could be described as an “assassin sand box” where you are free to kill the target in your own (sloppy) way.    Story  You play as a nameless man
column7: of little known past
column8: known only by his number: 47. He is a high skilled assassin
column9: who works for the mysterious agency ICA. The agency is hired by politicians and other high calliber figures in the global elite to eliminate people. The contact 47 has with the agency is mediated by  Diana Burnwood
column10: who works as 47’s boss and some kind of “mother figure” to him.   Gameplay   Most levels in this game work like this: you are set loose into an open world environment with people doing their jobs and thing. Among those people there your targets
column11: that you have to kill. If you want an easy mode
column12: you can follow the tips and hints given by the game. If you like fo figure things by yourself
column13: then turn off the notifications and try to kill the targets in your own sloppy way. Observing patterns of movement is key: each NPC usually has a routine of places he goes and things he does. If you need his outfit as disguise
column14: you just need to wait for him in that dark alley and then…   Agent 47 follows some kind of “perfect assassination honor code” were you are supposed to try to kill your targets in what is consedered the “perfect way”. So
column15: there are some rules you should try to follow
column16: such as: only kill the targets and no one eles
column17: not being see
column18: destrying evidences and só one. Every time you violate one of these rules
column19: you lose points
column20: which reflects in losing potential unlockable stuff in the end of the mission.     Problems  Agent 47 is a “good guy”.  I just dislike how the game devs tried to make Hitman
column21: Diana and their agency some kind of “good guys doing a dirty job”. I mean
column22: it seems like in every mission you are doing some kind of humanitary job by “killing evil people”. I don’t like this approach
column23: it would be better if they tried something more “neutral”
column24: were Agent 47 works for whoever pays more or something. Anyways
column25: this is kind of minor
column26: because the game has actually very little story whatsoever. One of the major complaints about “Hitman: Absolution” was that it was too much story driven and thous wasn’t a typical Hitman game. So
column27: in Hitman 2016
column28: they try to fix it and go back to the origins and focus more on the gameplay and level design than in story elements.  Mentally exausting. Also
column29: another thing
column30: and this is very personal to me
column31: is that this game seems to demand a lot of my head and after completing a mission I feel very tired of all that mental work. Each mission felt like and extended chess match
column32: were my brain and senses worked overtime to finally beat the mission. It’s not a game made to “play for fun” or “play for relaxation”
column33: at least not for me…   I Rate it 4.0/5.0

column6: Halo: Spartan Strike Like its predecessor " Spartan Assualt"
column7: the game is a from above " twin stick"  shooter spin-off Halo game. As mentioned in that review I recommend playing it with a  Xbox-360/One Controller . The story line is about palying as a Spartan/s
column8: denying the enemies the conquest of Earth. Now you will start to face the Prometheans
column9: the enemies introduced in " Halo 4"  and the graphics and overall game experience has improved with this installment.  There are still 30 missions
column10: but the side-missions (still 3 per level) are now displayed with the start of each mission and if you replay the mission you can even track the progress towards each mission. This is a great improvement and the grind missions are fewer
column11: but still some annoying ones. Overall I also felt that the difficulty was lower in this game eventhough I excpect theme to finish in about the same time. You can also make things easier by buying " perks-per mission" ( do not remember what they are called) increasing damage or score awarded etc. This is really helpful for achieving some of the harder gold medals. The game feels a little more original than " Spartan Assualt"  but still greatly incorporates the weapons and armor-abilities mostly found in the original series.   To Conclude    Halo spin-off game    Better graphics than previous installment    From above " twin stick"  shooter    30 levels    20 achievements    5 hour story     ~12 hours for 100% completion    3 side missions per level for a total of 90    Side-missions can now be viewed when entering a mission
column12: huge improvement over " Spartan Assualt"     -Still some grindy unimaginative side-missions   Halo: Spartan Strike  is an overall improvement to its previous installment " Spartan Assualt"  which still is fun to play and well made. It further expands from and stays true to the Halo series giving a solid time-killer experience. I highly recommend getting the bundle to get both " Halo: Spartan Strike/Assualt"

column6: 这次变革有，恐怖生存up，JUMP SCARE有，这一作的舞台是把从2代开始的大环境，浓缩回像一代洋馆一般的民宅（其实还挺大的）    什么厚厚书本里夹着道具，假枪换真枪，各种钥匙对应指定的门锁等等，都是初代的解谜套路，  让我露出了蜜汁微笑。而且这次说的回归恐怖，还真的是回归了，绝对童叟无欺。敌人比较难缠但可利用完美格挡应对之，对手残党不算太友好。  但个人感觉恐怖只在开头，后面有种变成B级搞笑片的感觉，越来越欢乐...  感谢超抗打的谐星贝克老爹出色的表演。    如果你还困在123代老生化的氛围下，可以试试，如果你只能接受456（尤其是6）那种突突突，那还是别浪费钱咯～要补完正传系列的话另当别论www  因为某卡又把正篇剧情当DLC卖了。    （Baker家的吉祥三宝简直神烦！年夜饭不想吃了！滚出去！)    这次有电锯！还真的能拿来肛！      顺便Lucas开门的音效是彩蛋哦www

column6: The Fruit of Grisaia :  Summary: The Fruit of Grisaia Genre: Visual Novel Developer: Front Wing Publisher: Sekai Project Release Date: 5/29/15  While more and more visual novels have been finding their way to the US as of late
column7: thanks to increased Western interest and some really quality releases in the genre to spark that interest
column8: it’s worth remembering that the Japanese market has been seeing these kinds of games for a long time now
column9: and we’re only starting to see some come stateside. That’s great
column10: frankly
column11: for fans and publishers alike; publishers have a veritable treasure trove of VN’s to pick through and bring to us as the fanbase grows for such games
column12: and fans can expect a whole lot of quality offerings from Japan because there’s a huge variety of things to choose from
column13: with large fanbases already installed to show the products are good. The Grisaia Trilogy
column14: as a whole
column15: is such an example
column16: and for the most part
column17: it’s one that’s been handled very well across the board. Sekai Project
column18: the US publisher for the game
column19: launched a Kickstarter for the trilogy
column20: and while some games that have been funded that way have taken more than a year to see any sort of release
column21: Sekai wasted no time getting the first game
column22: The Fruit of Grisaia
column23: out into the market while there was still some hype behind it. Not only that
column24: with the anime already simulcasting over at Crunchyroll
column25: there almost isn’t a better time to get the game out into the waiting hands of its backers and fans
column26: frankly. Of course
column27: a rushed product would only hurt the project going forward
column28: but for those who are afraid of such a thing
column29: let me reassure you up-front: The Fruit of Grisaia is an amazingly high-quality piece of work
column30: from start to finish
column31: and its translation is pretty damn good across the board. That’s not to say that there aren’t some minor hiccups along the way
column32: but for the most part
column33: backers and those of casual interest alike should take heed that
column34: even at the projected $30 asking price
column35: the game is well worth it.The Fruit of Grisaia is essentially the tale of Yuji Kazami
column36: new student transferring into Mihama Academy
column37: which essentially acts as a super-restrictive private school for people who have lots of issues and
column38: in most cases
column39: special reasons to be there. In Yuji’s case
column40: he’s something of a hired assassin
column41: working for the Japanese government due to various circumstances in his life. Having reached a point in his life where he’s wondering if there’s more to life than just killing people at the behest of his employer
column42: Yuji asks to experience a “normal” life for a while
column43: and while putting a trained killer into a normal school probably isn’t a great idea
column44: accommodations are made to place him in Mihama
column45: where his personality defects will be less problematic. As the plot progresses
column46: you’re introduced to his five female classmates: Amane
column47: a “horny big sister” type who’s repressing a good bit of her childhood
column48: Yumiko
column49: whose kuudere tendencies mask a life she’s not thrilled to be a part of
column50: Makina
column51: whose moe tendencies hide some odd familial issues
column52: Michiru
column53: a fake tsundere whose behavior masks something far more depressing
column54: and Sachi
column55: whose hyper-obedient nature comes from some less than pleasant roots. Yuji doesn’t especially want to get involved in any of this
column56: of course
column57: but part of living a normal life ends up being that you end up getting attached to people eventually
column58: and as the player
column59: it’s your job to guide Yuji into the life of one of these ladies
column60: in hopes of helping both the lady in question
column61: and Yuji.  My opinion :  The Fruit of Grisaia is a great visual novel with a time people really are imance this is main strength with a very good story adapted into an anime in 2014 two out season that really exlente is that racontre very good history with a supplement in oav. Level graphics the game is the problem of working around longer than I have appreciated most about the game is the fact that a lot of time as démarage the stop of the game ........ silk followed by the path to a character I really appreciate and the soundtrack is interesting music are just some epic. column6: Before diving in deeper
column7: I have to admit that I love this kind of casual games. IF you don't like casual or match 3 games
column8: then this one may not be for you. This game was given to me for beta testing
column9: so when the alpha comes out it may slightly be different.  ?	Presentation  This game is rather cute and cheerful considering the story. On the story I'll talk in a bit. First the menu. The background of the menu is a lovely beach (let's forget about the half sunken ship and the weird floating block of tofu). Crashing waves in the background. A bird chilping. It all makes you forget about the tofu infected pizzas and the zombies. Actually this game makes you want to go on a holiday or if you can't afford one just keep playing and match those bright coloured sweets. (Darn I want some sweets now)  Oh and if you click the menu background you get a small sparkle. Bit unneeded
column10: but cute none the less.  ?	Interface/Controls/Features  The controls are pretty straight forward and you get reminded enough what to do (if you keep the tutorial on). Now and then you will get a hint too. Just like most games in this genre you only need a mouse to play. The game sometimes react a bit too fast when it comes to swapping sweets
column11: but that could be more to due to my impatience than the programming itself.  One little feature came as a suprise
column12: but a good one. When you play and you are running low on turns you seem to get a bomb. And who doesn't like a nice BOOM?  Another feature is the difficult level. Like in most games you have 3 kinds. You have the normal setting
column13: the casual one where you get more turns in a level and the relax mode where you get only one star at the end but it has no turns. At the beginning of each level you can change this if needed.  ?	Plot  This is a bit of cliché as you
column14: the castaway
column15: strand on a remote island. By chance
column16: that island is literally the last resort of the fleeing masses from the zombies or better said rabid ex tofu lovers. Not totally original but it is filled with funny one liners and light hearted humor. Plus the focus is not so much on the story as on fun on playing the levels
column17: resort building
column18: puzzles and over all fun.  ?	Replayability  The levels are replayable and you might often have to do so. To get enough cash to build buildings for your resort or to get 3 stars on a level. The game also has different settings for the difficulty. Always handy if one level proves a bit hard or when your child wants to have a go too.  ?	Achievements  This game of zombilicious one-liners offers a bunch of achievements and some require some creative thinking.  ?	Conclusion  A fun 3 match game for the casual gamers or those who need a break from shooting the brains out of zombies. Just give them an overload of sweets and build that resort! And it offers divercity with the solitair tournament
column19: achievement hunting
column20: quest solving
column21: stickers hunting
column22: ..  Maybe a little tip but besides the 3 matching of sweets you also get a solitaire tournament after a while. So how is this useful info? Well let's say you are a bit stuck because you don't get enough cash from the normal levels. After all building is expensive everywhere. Then achievement hunting and the solitaire might get you there in your little paradise away from the mindless zombies.  One little thing that annoyed me after a while was the background sound at the solitaire tournament. Specially the laughter of the woman.

column6: Начиная со старшей школы с окружена стариками. В университете все мои одногруппники были стариками. Им было по 18 лет, но им пора было в могилу. Никаких целей, никаких идей, только бесконечная усталость на лице. Усталость и пустота. На работе все мои молодые коллеги - на самом деле глубокие старики. Они ни за что не готовы бороться. Они уже видят себя на пенсии.   КАКАЯ ЖИЗА. Никогда бы не подумал что в этой игре будут такие космические цитаты. А ведь в моей жизни это реально так. Но я бы никогда не придумал такие слова чтобы описать это. А эта игра смогла. Да по сюжету этой игры можно сериал снимать или фильм. Я только вот эту фразу обдумывал пару недель. Но помимо нее в игре столько глубокой философии что бошка улетает. А сам геймплей тут стандартный

column24: even areas that should be open have debris blocking your way so you're funneled through the linear intended path. You go through sewers. It hits all the clichés. Occasionally you stop to push a switch or turn a valve or fight waves of enemies until the game decides to let you go on. There are data diaries you can pick up. They have riveting anonymous text like " We're going to have to take a run for it the monsters are everywhere" . The PC version does not have achievements and there is no in-game incentive to find the diaries. I stopped reading them after a level or two.  The game would have taken me less than 5 hours
column25: but the checkpointing is pretty poor so expect to repeat long walking segments when you manage to get yourself killed at the end. I also ran into a 100% guaranteed bug just before the last checkpoint of the game that causes you to fall through the level geometry. To solve it you need to edit an INI to either bind a noclip to some control or to cap the framerate of the game at 30. This did not endear me to the game. It is well documented on Steam discussion forums.  One of the more positive reviews of the game claims it's 8 hours long. I'm sorry

Hope County é uma cidade ficticia no estado de montana nos Estados unidos que ao passar dos anos foi tomada pela seita de Joseph Seed. column11: they led me to him. It was as beautiful as the moon.  Perfect game in natural theme. 10/10  很喜欢这种自然主题的游戏，画风清新又不无聊，捕猎什么的真好玩啊！ 故事也是自然而然，温馨之中并不遮掩大自然的残酷，因为要是没照顾好幼崽，它们真的会饿死或者被鹰和狼吃掉。 在猞猁哺育下一代的生活中，能看出它的习性，大部分情节是很科学的（除了猞猁掉水里不能游，人家猞猁是游泳健将好吗！）。 家谱这个设定超棒，代代传承，可以无限玩下去！

すごく良く出来たVRアドベンチャ`。日本Z辏ㄗ帜唬。翻Uの|も良い。　  元々はDaydreamプラットフォ`ムのスマホVRコンテンツであり、OculusGOへの移植をUてPCのVRコンテンツとして入ってきている。 勿ちゃんとPCVRに最m化されており快mに操作ができる。  Pの殆どをAIが行っている、人gの仕事がAIにZわれた未来。 プレイヤ`は数少ない人gのP力として、VRプラットフォ`ムを介してAIを喜ばせる仕事に就く。 登訾工AIは クソコテ 曲者ばかりでをいているだけで面白い。 バタ`のAIが食パンをこんがりいて俺の上に\せてくれとか言ってくる。 意味がわからないだろうが自分もよく分からない。そういうAIばかり出てくる。 勿こちらの行婴摔夂韦椁の反辘蚴兢筏皮れるので、そのパタ`ンをるのもSしい。  エリアの移婴摔VRの中でVRHMDをかぶる、まさにVirtual Virtual Realityの表}の通り、VRの中でVRにダイブすることになる。 VRの中に深く潜るにつれ、なぜこのプラットフォ`ムが作られたのかが明かされる。 各エリアもよく作りzまれてあり、特に深いエリアは、SF映画?アニメであるような、入っては行けないスペ`スに立ち入っている感を受けd^した。LSDやゆめにっき的な怖さも感じたけど。  プレイrgは2rg半。かい要素をても3rg程度だと思う。 中身はネタバレ禁系なのでかくはかないが、VRHMDを持っている人なら是非プレイしてもらいたい一作。Stanley ParableとかPortalとか好きならきっと荬巳毪搿

column34: hay una razón propia del protagonista para adentrarse en esa ciudad y el personaje evoluciona en narrativa. No es el mismo James que se miraba al espejo en la entrada del pueblo que el mismo al enfrentarse a la realidad de Mary al final del mismo. Con Sebastian Castellanos pasa precisamente lo mismo en este juego.   Sebastian empieza como un hombre quebrado y arruinado y evoluciona de una forma increible. Flowers -Le volume sur printemps-  is a yuri visual novel  developed by Innocent Grey and published on Steam  by JAST USA. However
column7: Flowers stands out on its own. Set in a Victorian-esque school in Japan
column8: it warms your heart to see the characters grow. You see them learn. You see them falter. You see them practice. Most of all
column9: you see them interact. the game truly shines through its music
column10: artwork
column11: and story development.    Music:   The music is absolutely amazing. It was very relaxing and had a very chill tone to it. The piano was uplifting at times and
column12: at other times
column13: downright depressing. It was very fitting.     Artwork:   It just shines. . Flowers is the type of visual novel that the artwork attracted me first. I had no idea what kind of story this game had other than it was a yuri (Girl x Girl) visual novel. The British-inspired backgrounds really made the game feel like was outside of Japan and the pretty-looking sprites gave my eyes plenty of treats. The CGs also pack a punch.    Story Development:   I may have come for the art
column14: but I definitely stuck around for the story. A brilliant story of how a recluse decides to change herself for the better becomes even better once the element of emotion was added to the story. Flowers is the story of Suoh Shirahane . As a person who rarely attended public school and was home-schooled for most of her life
column15: she is sheltered and  in her own corner of her mind. With the help of the school’s special Amitié system (Friendship System)
column16: she tries to change herself to be more outgoing and less of a shut-in. However
column17: that is not as easy as one would think. The story also does not take this lightly and properly explores the reason she is how she is. Not only that
column18: but it also explores the lives of the other characters and their developments through the game. The story definitely left a good impact on me. I also very much enjoyed how the game had an intellectual factor. The “quick-time events” where Suoh needed to know certain info in order to progress was actually fun and had me looking up info to things I was culturally oblivious to before. refreshing for a visual novel to expand my knowledge and Flowers certainly did that for me. With all that said
column19: mind you
column20: the game does have its flaws. For one
column21: it is absolutely riddled with grammar and editing mistakes. Sometimes
column22: it was obvious; sometimes
column23: not so obvious. For the most part
column24: though
column25: the reading was solid.    Pros:      great artwork    Unabashed storytelling    Relaxing Soundtrack    Intellectual engagement     Cons:      Riddled with grammar/spelling errors     Fullscreen can be temperamental    Voices can be unbalanced at times.  I highly recommend Flowers -Le volume sur printemps- very much. It’s intellectually gripping at times
column26: comical at others
column27: and an overall
column28: very good read. I had fun with its mysteries
column29: learning
column30: and storytelling. Even with the apparent flaws
column31: the game is actually fun and lovingly crafted.  Also yuri  ( ?° ?? ?°)  This novel gets a solid 8/10 for me

column6: Escape the Past  is a rather short and simple adventure game with basically no story whatsoever. Despite this (I mean having no story in an adventure game is a rather serious issue) the game is something that could be called a relaxing experience for roughly about 2 hours while it lasts.  The game consists of 4 chapters and our goal is to escape or leave a mysterious island
column7: where apparently 'time does not pass and every day is the same'. Unfortunately there aren't any introduction or cutscenes
column8: all we get are letters (what's written in them can symbolize many things depending what we want to envision or see into them) at the end of each chapter
column9: after reaching the exit (which is usually a door of some sort). The puzzles are quite easy and we can only get stuck by not noticing an item that can be used (or by playing the entire 1st chapter through in French
column10: just like I did). The game provides many hints though
column11: usually suggesting what kind of an item we need in order to progress. The user interface is the same as the one commonly used in other point-and-click adventure games: we see our items listed below and by selecting them we can use them on the screen
column12: where we think an interactive object might be. Some of the items can (and must) be combined. In each chapter
column13: other than finding the exit
column14: we can also collect 5 gems and the 3 pieces of said letter we can read at the end of the chapters.  While the graphics is not something I would call nice
column15: the art style is interesting and it uses warm colours which are pleasing to the eye. I liked the music as it was relaxing
column16: but again it's not something I'd call a masterpiece. There's no voice acting (there is no other creature than us on the island anyway) or any spoken dialogue at all
column17: not even narration. Make sure to set the language to English (or German
column18: or whatever language you speak and is available) in the menu by clicking on the large flag
column19: because originally it is set to French.    Escape the Past  is a simplistic but relaxing little adventure game
column20: which may offer some entertainment despite not really having a story. While 5 may be a bit much for it
column21: at a 75% discount I would recommend it for some short-term casual fun.  PROS + easy puzzles if you like them + enjoyable gameplay + relaxing music  CONS - not much of a story - very short - base price could be lower  RATING 5.5/10

column6: Let me get this straight ahead and confirm that the wait for SOMA was
column8: well-worth it. Frictional delivers yet another masterpiece. I even dare say they followed the saying: ''There's always room for more.''
column9: after their fantastic Amnesia series. What we got from them here is one of those existential questioning games... combine that with horror
column10: well-suited atmosphere
column11: incredible  sound effects and you get a memorable gem.  SOMA has less enemy encounters than Amnesia
column12: but I say it's for a good cause. What it lacks in terms of monsters
column13: it completely delivers with the story. I'd say they got the perfect balance between hiding and actual advancing through the events. More encounters would have made me forget about the plot and it would have gotten unimmersive. But when there is a monster showing around
column14: expect it to be a challenging part. No more hiding in a corner and waiting for it to leave as in previous games
column15: as SOMA's creatures are not just randomly going away after a while. They'll stay in your path and you have to carefully progress through the chambers and remember the map
column16: in order to get away safe and sound.  I did mention this is more of an existentional questioning game. I can't dig deeper into details on this one as it would all lead to story-breaking spoilers. Heck
column17: even the premise of it is a spoiler. All I can say is that it successfully made me question what it is to be a human and what distinguishes us from artificial intelligences --robots-- .  What I also loved about it was its length. 13 hours to finish an indie game is nothing short of amazing and I didn't even stay to read all notes and journals. I'll definitely give this game a second playthrough.  The inventory has been massively simplified since Amnesia and the sanity/health system is also changed. Looking at some monsters for too long will give away your position and health can be restored at healing places throughout the journey.  Technically speaking
column18: the game suffers from a poor optimization. I was getting massive frame drops in some places. Visually it does not excel either. But I can get past these issues coming from a small company. On the other side
column19: I haven't encountered many bugs nor grammatical errors and kudos to the developers for taking their time and patching up their game!  *End-game debate incoming (definitely spoilers ahead); please skip to next paragraph for general personal rating if you haven't completed the game yet.* The feeling that was following me up to the very end was one of déjà vu. There is another game out there that raised the exact same questioning:   The Talos Principle. Apocalypse
column20: AI that would replace the mankind and would live through a new aeon? These two games are as if set in the same universe. If you put away the gameplay of them
column21: you will notice that they both follow the same plot.  Is artificial intelligence capable of replacing the human brain? In SOMA
column22: a group of scientists work in projecting it on digital chips. The Talos Principle follows a similar path
column23: with one AI already constructed and left in sleep mode until it proves that it acts and  thinks  humanlike. In both games you are playing as a virtual mind placed into a carcass
column24: in order to continue human legacy. Could these two games be set in the same world? The similarities between them are astonishing. Also
column25: SOMA's concept of replicating someone's mind is extremely intriguing. Are you the first AI copy of Simon after his death? Like in the end of the game
column26: where he is duplicated and a part of him remains alone for an eternity on a wasted planet
column27: while the other rests forever in the ARK
column28: on a digital island.. The main character could very well not be the first copy of his brain awoken.      Pros:   + Excellent plot and an overall amazing storyline. The journey that the player takes from the beginning to the end never ceased to amaze me. + Incredible sound effects. Not just one time have I thought some environment sounds are actually coming from my room.  + Perfect mix of horror and story telling. + Impressively long while still maintaining to not get boring. + Great puzzles that add to the core
column29: just like in the Amnesia series. + The atmosphere perfectly blends in. + The voice acting is also well-crafted. + More types of monsters with different behaviors. They also have some great sound effects implemented
column30: you will hear them if they're wandering on a nearby corridor or if they have detected you. + Overall balanced difficulty. Does not make the player replay the same area countless of times due to dying
column31: but is also thought as to not be rushed through with ease. + Does continue Frictional's unique horror style.    Neutral:   +/- Different system of health and sanity
column32: like shortly described above. Some players may welcome the changes with open arms
column33: while others may dislike it compared to the old one from Amnesia: The Dark Descent. +/- Depending on everyone's tastes
column34: I suppose the game suffers from a lack of replayability. +/- Enemy AI. They're not brainless
column35: but nothing amazing about their thinking either.    Cons:   - Poor optimization... may encounter frame drops
column36: stutter and even freezes in some areas
column37: even while lowering the settings. - Infinite battery flashlight. A similar system to the one from older Frictional titles would also suit SOMA better in my opinion and would add to the difficulty. - Uhm... where's the enemy robots? I was disappointed to only encounter the big machines with flashlights 2 or 3 times and only in the first quarter of the game... They were some great enemies in my opinion and would have surely also suited some other areas. - Can get extremely frustrating to cope with the visual screen tearing while the monster is chasing you. Later on in the game
column38: you're almost always getting caught by it if he sees you
column39: anyway.  SOMA is a must for anyone that loved Frictional's other games. For the others

column6: Anfang 2015 in Erwartung eines Ultima Online-Nachfolgers gekauft. In UO hab ich ne gefühlte Lebenszeit investiert (auf dem fantastischen freeshard Siebenwind).   Shroud of the Avatar ist aber leider eher ein 3D-Immobilienmanager in einem unattraktiven
column7: leblosen Setting.  Und es scheint so als würden die Entwickler es dabei belassen.   Dagegen wirkt Ultima IX wie ein stabiler AAA-RPG-Superhit - wahrscheinlich will Lord British sich diesmal einen Flug zum Mars finanzieren.  Ich kann nur empfehlen sich mal über " Legends of Aria"  schlau zu machen

column6: 优点：很不错的游戏，一直都在找工人物语类型的好游戏。这款游戏如果故事情节能做的好的话绝对能够超越工人物语成为经典！！！感觉综合了工人物语和魔兽争霸，还引入了英雄模式，天气模式很新颖，升级体系、资源配比错综复杂，研究起来很有趣。不同的4各种族各有特性，将来引入故事情节之后应该会很耐玩。 游戏画面也蛮不错的，但不知道为什么不能调节分辨率，我的Retina Mac book pro 装了windows玩2880*1800分辨率太高对机器的压力有点大，经常感觉反应很迟钝，不流畅。  缺点的话：可能为了迎合中国消费者特别推出了中文版，但中文翻译居然直接用机器翻的。。。语句不通，还不如直接看英语明白。  To Developers: I really  LIKE  this game

column6: Panzermadels: Tank Dating Simulator :  Summary:  Erwin Lemmor just got transferred to a prestigious military academy to study Armored Warfare. But when he arrives
column7: Erwin realizes it's not Tank School
column8: but " Tank School"  for World War II Tanks. Who happen to look just like Japanese School Girls...!  Instead of studying military history and doctrine
column9: he's in " Basic Artillery Computations for Fire Support 101"
column10: and " Radio Operations 214" . Will he win the heart of the tank-girls
column11: or end up as cannon fodder? Only you can decide in
column12: " Panzermadels: Tank Dating Simulator" . Panzermadels is made by 'DEVGRU-P' a small team of American developers in the style of a traditional Japanese Visual Novel. Unabashedly goofy
column13: the game takes every trope you know from visual novels

column6: 对这个游戏，我态度是矛盾的。之前很早就开始玩了，然后随着一次次版本升级  灌屎    行为。游戏几乎与最初版本完全不同了。早期的版本我是非常喜欢，现在的版本。。。。我无法评价。。。弃坑中。。。。对新人还可以玩玩。对我这种老玩家，有点不适应。 抱怨说完了，说下优点吧。 载具完全靠自己的设计，手残党也不用担心。游戏中有其他玩家设计的载具可以租用。可以说你遇到的敌人和队友千奇百怪，有坑也有神。乐趣十足，对于新人来说是一种全新的体验。游戏模式也相对简单，直接正面对肛，抢点，boss战（低级玩家挑战高级玩家）。游戏的输赢首先载具的设计好与坏，在才是操作方面。
Ностальгия в чистом виде. Удивился
